Key Arguments: The government should not have the authority to decide what is truth and what is fiction.
The legislation is seen as a step towards tyranny, despite potentially good intentions.
Free speech is essential for hearing all sides and making personal decisions.
The proposed legislation is viewed as an overreach of government power and an assault on free speech and liberty.
Notable Quotes: How can the Government decide what is truth and what is fiction?
The road to tyranny is always laid with good intentions.
This egregious overreach of government power is a direct assault on free speech and the liberty of all Australians.
